name: Stir-Fried Spicy Asparagus
description: Holding out for regional produce may seem absurdly romantic, or a little stubborn, but there’s no denying the thrill when, after months of apples, potatoes and sturdy greens, suddenly asparagus appears in full force at the market. Finally, spring has arrived.
keywords: asparagus, garlic, ginger, side dish, spring
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 pounds pencil-thin asparagus (or substitute small or medium asparagus, split lengthwise)
1 serrano or other fresh hot chile, finely chopped
A large handful of basil, mint and cilantro leaves

recipeInstructions.text: Snap off and discard the tough bottoms of each asparagus spear. Cut the asparagus into 2-inch lengths

In a wok or cast-iron skillet, heat the oil until nearly smoking. Add the asparagus, season generously with salt and pepper and stir well, making sure the asparagus is coated and glistening with oil. Continue to stir-fry over high heat for about 1 minute, until the asparagus looks bright green and barely cooked. Add the garlic, ginger and chile and stir-fry for 30 seconds more.
Transfer to a serving platter and scatter   leaves on top. Serve immediately.
